register.description: APB main control register

bitfield.description: When 1 stalls the CPU from executing further instructions.

register.description: Inernal CPU Interrupt Polarity Control Register.

bitfield.description: Each bit inverts appropriate interrupt signal provided do internal CPU interrupt input.

register.description: Mailbox full indication status register. This register provides a status of the mailbox that is used to send messages from the Host processor to internal uCPU.Mailbox full flag can be a source of mailbox interrupt.

Mailbox empty indication status register. This register provides a status of the mailbox that is used to send responses from the internal uCPU to host processor as a result of previously sent message.Mailbox empty flag can be a source of not-empty mailbox interrupt.

register.description: Core Clock frequency

Bits [7:0] of the software events status vector. This register is used to report internal events that have been detected by the firmware to the host processor. Register is written by the internal uCPU. It is cleared upon read by the Host processor. Reported events can be source of interrupt reported in APB_INT_STATUS[1] register if this interrupt is enabled.Detailed description of the currently supported events can be found in HD Display TX Controller Programming Interface document.

bitfield.description: Each bit represents a separate event reported by the internal uCPU.

register.description: FEC IP test register. Used for fault injection into the FEC IP to test diagnostic mechanisms.

bitfield.description: When asserted, a corruption is injected at the interface of the internal diagnostic module which generate a fault in the 8b10b check of the FEC IP datapath for lanes 2 and 3.
When asserted, a corruption is injected at the interface of the internal diagnostic module which generate a fault in the parity enc check of the FEC IP datapath for lanes 2 and 3.
When asserted, a corruption is injected at the interface of the internal diagnostic module which generate a fault in the parity gen check of the FEC IP datapaths for lanes 2 and 3.
When asserted, a corruption is injected at the interface of the internal diagnostic module which generate a fault in the bypass check for of the FEC IP datapathe for lanes 2 and 3.
When asserted, a corruption is injected at the interface of the internal diagnostic module which generate a fault in the 8b10b check of the FEC IP datapath for lanes 0 and 1.
When asserted, a corruption is injected at the interface of the internal diagnostic module which generate a fault in the parity enc check of the FEC IP datapath for lanes 0 and 1.
When asserted, a corruption is injected at the interface of the internal diagnostic module which generate a fault in the parity gen check of the FEC IP datapath for lanes 0 and 1.
When asserted, a corruption is injected at the interface of the internal diagnostic module which generate a fault in the bypass check for of the FEC IP datapath for lanes 0 and 1.

register.description: SYS_CLK and 2 MHz clock ratio. This register is used to ensure correct AUX channel bitrate for different values of a system clock.

register.description: Pre charge field length.

bitfield.description: Length of pre charge field, standard definition is 10 to 16 bits/clocks.

register.description: Maximum legal receiving frequency.

bitfield.description: The maximum legal frequency receiving from the line by the standard is 1.25MHz.The calculation is:[1.25 MHz cycle time]/[sys_clk[-15%] cycle time] 800/

register.description: Minimum legal receiving frequency.

bitfield.description: The minimum legal frequency receiving from the line by the standard is 0.83MHz.The calculation is:[0.83 MHz cycle time]/[sys_clk[+15%] cycle time] 1200/

register.description: MSA horizontal parameters. This settings define MSA content (not used for input video stream parameters). This field must be set prior video is enabled and must not be changed when video transmission is active. Offset = 3000h + (j * 80h); where j = 0h to 3h

register.description: Video Horizontal parameters. This register must be programmed prior enabling video and must not be changed while video is being transmitted.In case of compressed stream transmission (DSC) and split panel mode values in this register must be divided by 2 since VIF interface operates at pixel clock divided by 2. This will ensure the same timing compared to uncompressed stream and. Offset = 3030h + (j * 80h); where j = 0h to 3h

register.description: SDP scheduling control register. Allows for tuning when SDP can be sent during blanking periods. This register must be programmed prior enabling video and must not be changed while video is being transmitted. Offset = 303Ch + (j * 80h); where j = 0h to 3h

register.description: Stream slots allocation in MST mode. This register defines slots in the MTP assigned to a given stream. All slots between start and and are assigned to the stream. bitfield.description: Holds the first 32 bits of the Ki frame key from this HDCP device.

register.description: Last 3 bytes of the Ki frame key from this HDCP device.

bitfield.description: Holds the last 3 bytes of the Ki frame key from this HDCP device.

register.description: This register defines number of iterations for SHA-1 calculations

bitfield.description: Number of iterations for SHA-1 calculation.

register.description: Key memory control register. Writing data to this register transfers data to the key RAM. This is input for DKS block. First 32 bits

Key memory control register. Writing data to this register transfers data to the key RAM. When data is written to this register, pulse key_mem_vld shall be also generated to the core_clk clock domain, as indication of new key_mem_data. This is input for DKS block. Last 3 bytes

SHA1 message control register. 32-bit word for SHA-1 message. Input for SHA-1 block. Writing data to this register transfers data to the SHA-1 block. Write to this register shall be repeated 16 times.
SHA1 message status register. First 32-bit word for SHA-1 calculation. Output from SHA-1 block

bitfield.description: First 32-bit word for SHA-1 calculation value.

register.description: SHA1 message status register. Second 32-bit word for SHA-1 calculation. Output from SHA-1 block

bitfield.description: Second 32-bit word for SHA-1 calculation value.

register.description: SHA1 message status register. Third 32-bit word for SHA-1 calculation. Output from SHA-1 block

bitfield.description: Third 32-bit word for SHA-1 calculation value.

register.description: SHA1 message status register. Third 32-bit word for SHA-1 calculation. Output from SHA-1 block
SHA1 message status register. 5th 32-bit word for SHA-1 calculation. Output from SHA-1 block
Xtensa Instruction RAM address space. Accessed only during boot mode to load firmware. Offset = 00010000h + (y * 4h); where y = 0h to 3FFFh
Xtensa Data RAM address space. Accessed only during boot mode to load firmware. Offset = 00020000h + (y * 4h); where y = 0h to 3FFFh
Audio source control

bitfield.description: Force valid bits of the channels
Enable I2S Time Stamp when decoders are disabled
Enable SPDIF Time Stamp when decoders are disabled
Force a Block Start in the audio stream

register.description: Audio source configuration

bitfield.description: When low MSB is transmitted first.

register.description: SPDIF control
SPDIF channel 1 status [31:00]
SPDIF channel 1 status [63:32]
SPDIF channel 1 status [95:64]
SPDIF channel 1 status [127:96]
SPDIF channel 1 status [159:128]
SPDIF channel 1 status [191:160]

SPDIF channel 2 status [95:64]

Sample 2 Packets Control Register

bitfield.description: When high Sample to Packets Block starts.

register.description: Sample 2 Packets Config Register

bitfield.description: Sample present bits if force them is active
Number of sub-packets in HDMI audio

register.description: FIFO control register

bitfield.description: When high the last channel index synchronizes the write addresses [to the next channel group]
Resets Fifo's write and read pointers.

register.description: FIFO Status register

bitfield.description: Indicates a FIFO underrun error has occured - FIFO read when it was empty.
Indicates a FIFO overrun error has occured - FIFO written to when it was full.

register.description: SUB Packet Threshold register

bitfield.description: If number of samples in MEM FIFO is below Threshold
If number of samples in MEM FIFO is below Threshold
If number of samples in MEM FIFO is below Threshold

register.description: 4 MSB of the packet memory address in which the data is written. Offset = 00030800h + (j * 40h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: 4 MSB of the packet memory address in which the data is written.

register.description: Write request bit for the host write transaction. Offset = 00030804h + (j * 40h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Write request bit for the host write transaction, active high.

register.description: 4 MSB of the packet memory address from which the data is read. Offset = 00030808h + (j * 40h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: 4 MSB of the packet memory address from which the data is read.

register.description: Read request bit for the host read transaction. Offset = 0003080Ch + (j * 40h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Read request bit for the host read transaction, active high.

register.description: The 32 bits of the data to be written to the packet memory. Offset = 00030810h + (j * 40h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: The 32 bits of the data to be written to the packet memory.

register.description: The 32 bits of the data to be read from the packet memory. Offset = 00030814h + (j * 40h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: The 32 bits of the data to be read from the packet memory.

register.description: Fifo1 flush Offset = 00030818h + (j * 40h); where j = 0h to 3h
Fifo2 flush Offset = 0003081Ch + (j * 40h); where j = 0h to 3h
Status bits for the PIF module Offset = 00030820h + (j * 40h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Fifo2 empty indication, when high indicates that FIFO2 is empty
Fifo1 full indication, when high indicates that FIFO1 is full
State of the FSM that controls packet memory transactions.

register.description: Interrupt sources of the PIF module, active high. Automatically cleared on read. If any of this interrupt is enabled and triggered bit apb_pif_intr_status in APB_INT_STATUS register is set. Offset = 00030824h + (j * 40h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Error happened, invalid write to the allocation table.
Successful write to the allocation table.
Indication that nonvalid type of packet is requested by the packet interface.
Indication that the host read transaction finished.
Indication that the host write transaction finished.

register.description: Masks for the interrupt sources in the SOURCE_PIF_INTERRUPT_SOURCE register, when set high, these bits disable the corresponding interrupts Offset = 00030828h + (j * 40h); where j = 0h to 3h
Packet configuration to be stored in the allocation table Offset = 0003082Ch + (j * 40h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Indicates in which mode the SDP will be sent.
Address of the register in the source allocation table

register.description: Enable bit for writing to the allocation table Offset = 00030830h + (j * 40h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: Enable bit for writing to the allocation table, active high

register.description: Software reset. Offset = 00030834h + (j * 40h); where j = 0h to 3h
PPS header Offset = 00030838h + (j * 40h); where j = 0h to 3h

bitfield.description: value of the PPS header as per DPv1.4

register.description: PPS SDP indication Offset = 0003083Ch + (j * 40h); where j = 0h to 3h
AUX Configuration Register

bitfield.description: Enables output resistor segments for termination impedance.
TX current for output diff pair.
Control for lowering AUX transmitter swing level.
Hysteresis control for AUX receiver front end.
Suppresses high-frequency pulses on AUX receiver output.
Disables internal receiver cmn mode offset.

register.description: AUX Control Register
AUX IP test control register.
AUX IP interface status.

bitfield.description: Raw status of aux_data_out output from AUX IP
Raw status of HPD output from AUX IP

register.description: PHY Reset Control Register

bitfield.description: PMA Tx electrical idle for line 3.
PMA Tx electrical idle for line 2.
PMA Tx electrical idle for line 1.
PMA Tx electrical idle for line 0.

register.description: PHY Link PLL Clock Enable Register

bitfield.description: Link PLL clock enable used to cleanly turn off the data rate clock in the PMA for line 3,
Link PLL clock enable used to cleanly turn off the data rate clock in the PMA for line 2,
Link PLL clock enable used to cleanly turn off the data rate clock in the PMA for line 1,
Link PLL clock enable used to cleanly turn off the data rate clock in the PMA for line 0,

register.description: PHY Link PLL Clock Status Register

bitfield.description: Link PLL clock enable acknowledgement, indicates whether the data rate clock in the PMA for line 3 is running.
Link PLL clock enable acknowledgement, indicates whether the data rate clock in the PMA for line 2 is running.
Link PLL clock enable acknowledgement, indicates whether the data rate clock in the PMA for line 1 is running.
Link PLL clock enable acknowledgement, indicates whether the data rate clock in the PMA for line 0 is running.

register.description: PHY Link Power State Request Register. Please refer to PHY Specification for detailed power state values
PHY Link Power State Status Register

bitfield.description: Link power state acknowledgement, this signal provides indication that a power state change request has completed.
Link power state acknowledgement, this signal provides indication that a power state change request has completed.
Link power state acknowledgement, this signal provides indication that a power state change request has completed.
Link power state acknowledgement, this signal provides indication that a power state change request has completed.

register.description: PMA Operation Status Register
PMA Tx Voltage Margin Control Register. Please refer to PHY Specification for Voltage Margin settings.

bitfield.description: Drives PMA input tx_vmargin_ln_3 for the associated lane.
Drives PMA input tx_vmargin_ln_2 for the associated lane.
Drives PMA input tx_vmargin_ln_1 for the associated lane.
Drives PMA input tx_vmargin_ln_0 for the associated lane.

register.description: PMA Tx Deemphasis Level Control Register. Please refer to PHY Specification for Deemphasis Level settings.

bitfield.description: Drives PMA input tx_deemphasis_ln_3 for the associated lane.
Drives PMA input tx_deemphasis_ln_2 for the associated lane.
Drives PMA input tx_deemphasis_ln_1 for the associated lane.
Drives PMA input tx_deemphasis_ln_0 for the associated lane.

register.description: ASF control register, imlemented only when ASF support is enabled in IP configuration

bitfield.description: When set, enables parity check at APB/SAPB address bus.

register.description: ASF Interrupt Status Register. This register indicates the source of ASF interrupts. The corresponding bit in the mask register must be clear for a bit to be set. If any bit is set in this register the asf_fatal or asf_nonfatal signal will be asserted. Writing to either raw or masked status registers, clear both registers. For test purposes, trigger signal interrupt event by writing to the ASF interrupt status test register.

bitfield.description: Integrity error interrupt,1 is active, 0 is not active
Protocol error interrupt,1 is active, 0 is not active
Transaction timeouts error interrupt,1 is active, 0 is not active
Configuration and status registers error interrupt,1 is active, 0 is not active
Data and address paths parity error interrupt,1 is active, 0 is not active
SRAM uncorrectable error interrupt,1 is active, 0 is not active
SRAM correctable error interrupt,1 is active, 0 is not active

register.description: ASF Interrupt Raw Status Register. A bit set in this raw register indicates a source of ASF fault in the corresponding feature. Writing to either raw or masked status registers, clear both registers. For test purposes, trigger signal interrupt event by writing to the ASF interrupt status test register.

bitfield.description: Integrity error interrupt,1 is active, 0 is not active
Protocol error interrupt,1 is active, 0 is not active
Transaction timeouts error interrupt,1 is active, 0 is not active
Configuration and status registers error interrupt,1 is active, 0 is not active
Data and address paths parity error interrupt,1 is active, 0 is not active
SRAM uncorrectable error interrupt,1 is active, 0 is not active
SRAM correctable error interrupt,1 is active, 0 is not active

register.description: The ASF interrupt mask register indicating which interrupt bits in the ASF interrupt status register are masked. All bits are set at reset. Clear the individual bit to enable the corresponding interrupt.

bitfield.description: Mask bit for Integrity error interrupt, 0 is active, 1 is not active.
Mask bit for Protocol error interrupt, 0 is active, 1 is not active.Interrupt from source which mask is 0 is permitted, otherwise interrupt is not permitted
Mask bit for Transaction timeouts error interrupt, 0 is active, 1 is not active.
Mask bit for Configuration and status registers error interrupt, 0 is active, 1 is not active.
Mask bit for Data and address paths parity error interrupt, 0 is active, 1 is not active.
Mask bit for SRAM uncorrectable error interrupt, 0 is active, 1 is not active.
Mask bit for SRAM correctable error interrupt, 0 is active, 1 is not active.

register.description: The ASF interrupt test register emulate hardware even. Write one to individual bit to trigger single event in (masked and raw) status registers according to mask and will generate interrupt accordingly.

bitfield.description: Test bit for Integrity error interrupt,1 is active, 0 is not active
Test bit for Protocol error interrupt,1 is active, 0 is not active
Test bit for Transaction timeouts error interrupt,1 is active, 0 is not active
Test bit for Configuration and status registers error interrupt,1 is active, 0 is not active
Test bit for Data and address paths parity error interrupt,1 is active, 0 is not active
Test bit for SRAM uncorrectable error interrupt,1 is active, 0 is not active
Test bit for SRAM correctable error interrupt,1 is active, 0 is not active

register.description: The fatal or non-fatal interrupt register selects whether a fatal (asf_int_fatal) or non-fatal (asf_int_nonfatal) interrupt is triggered. If the bit of the event will be set to one then fatal interrupt (asf_int_fatal) will be triggered. Otherwise the non-fatal interrupt (asf_int_nonfatal) will be triggered.

bitfield.description: Enable Integrity error interrupt as fatal,1 is fatal interrupt, 0 is non-fatal
Enable Protocol error interrupt as fatal,1 is fatal interrupt, 0 is non-fatal
Enable Transaction timeouts error interrupt as fatal,1 is fatal interrupt, 0 is non-fatal
Enable Configuration and status registers error interrupt as fatal,1 is fatal interrupt, 0 is non-fatal
Enable Data and address paths parity error interrupt as fatal,1 is fatal interrupt, 0 is non-fatal
Enable SRAM uncorrectable error interrupt as fatal,1 is fatal interrupt, 0 is non-fatal
Enable SRAM correctable error interrupt as fatal,1 is fatal interrupt, 0 is non-fatal

register.description: Status register for SRAM correctable fault. These fields are updated whenever asf_sram_corr_fault input is active.

bitfield.description: Last SRAM instance that generated fault
Last SRAM address that generated fault

register.description: Status register for SRAM uncorrectable fault. These fields are updated whenever asf_sram_uncorr_fault input is active.

bitfield.description: Last SRAM instance that generated fault
Last SRAM address that generated fault

register.description: Statistics register for SRAM faults. Note that this register clears when software writes to any field.

bitfield.description: Count of number of uncorrectable errors if implemented.
Count of number of correctable errors if implemented.

register.description: Control register to configure the ASF transaction timeout monitors.

bitfield.description: Enable transaction timeout monitoring,1 is active,0 is not active
Timer value to use for transaction timeout monitor

register.description: Control register to mask out ASF transaction timeout faults from triggering interrupts. On reset, all bits are set to mask out all sources. Clear the corresponding bit to enable the interrupt source. The width of this field is parameterisable and the bit definitions are implementation specific.

bitfield.description: Mask bit for SAPB interface for transaction timeout fault,0 is active, 1 is not active.Interrupt from source which mask is 0 is permitted, otherwise interrupt is not permitted
Mask bit for APB interface for transaction timeout fault,0 is active, 1 is not active.Interrupt from source which mask is 0 is permitted, otherwise interrupt is not permitted
Mask bit for Xtensa watchdog error for transaction timeout fault,0 is active, 1 is not active.Interrupt from source which mask is 0 is permitted, otherwise interrupt is not permitted

register.description: Status register for transaction timeouts fault. If a fault occurs the revelant status bit will be set to 1. Each bit can be cleared by software writing 1 to each bit.

bitfield.description: Status bits for SAPB interface for transaction timeout fault,1 is active, 0 is not active
Status bits for APB interface for transaction timeout fault,1 is active, 0 is not active
Status bits for Xtensa watchdog error for transaction timeout fault,1 is active, 0 is not active

register.description: Control register to mask out ASF Protocol faults from triggering interrupts. On reset, all bits are set to mask out all sources. Clear the corresponding bit to enable the interrupt source. The width of this field is parameterisable and the bit definitions are implementation specific.

bitfield.description: Mask bit for FEC FSM fault.
Mask bit for 8b10b Encoding fault from FEC module.
Mask bit for Party Encoding fault from FEC module.
Mask bit for Parity Generation fault from FEC module.

register.description: Status register for protocol faults. If a fault occurs the revelant status bit will be set to 1. Each bit can be cleared by software writing 1 to each bit

bitfield.description: Party Encoding fault in FEC module.
Parity Generation fault in FEC module.

register.description: Encoder common configuration values

bitfield.description: Active-High to enable auto update double buffer regs on vsync falling edge.
When split_panel and multiplex_mode are set, indicates that multiplexer output separated chunks [inserts zeros on partial words at each end of chunk] and signal end of chunks.
Indicates if the De-Rasterization Buffer is used or bypassed: '1' Active '0' Bypassed
When split_panel and multiplex_mode are set, indicates to which output the multiplexed stream is sent: '0': enc0_data_out '1': enc1_data_out
Active-High, indicates that both encoders are used to produce a multiplex stream on a single Transport link.
Active-High, indicates that both encoders are used in parallel for one video stream [L and R split].

register.description: Encoder Main Configuration values

bitfield.description: Number of lines to wait before initiating transport in Command Mode.
Forces the ICH to reset at EOL [when not in split mode].
MIPI Video/Command mode: '0' Command mode '1' Video mode
Depth of the line buffer used by the decoder [i.e., the number of bits stored for each component of the pixels on the previous line]
Active-High input to indicate the data_in pixels are
Active-High input to indicate the data_in pixels are RGB.
Indicates the current input pixel stream bits per component:

register.description: Encoder Interrupt Clear. Setting any one of these bits, clears the corresponding ENC_INT_STAT bits. This register is self-clearing after 8 regs_pclk cycles.

bitfield.description: Encoder is started to process a frame

bitfield.description: Encoder is started to process a frame

bitfield.description: Each bit of the expected CRC can be corrupted separately [one bit at a time] using this register.

bitfield.description: Each bit of the expected CRC can be corrupted separately [one bit at a time] using this register.

register.description: Hard Slice 0 Test for Output Checker. Each bit (one at a time) can used to corrupt various input/parameter values of the module.

bitfield.description: Reserved but this field is a R/W field that returns the same value that was written to it.

register.description: Hard Slice 1 Test for Output Checker. Each bit (one at a time) can used to corrupt various input/parameter values of the module.

bitfield.description: Reserved but this field is a R/W field that returns the same value that was written to it.
